subject: meta-fii/meta-kudo: Fix power control states and timing
commitMessage:
meta-fii/meta-kudo: Fix power control states and timing

Summary of changes:
 1. Adjust start time of xyz.openbmc_project.State.Chassis.service
    to fix initial chassis state
 2. Add shutdown ack service
 3. Remove reset ack service
 4. Remove heartbeat mode
 5. Remove sysreset pin control from power_control.exe
 6. Remove all phosphor-fan services that caused power off during
    a system reset
 7. Adjustments to ampere_power_util.sh (See below)

ampere_power_util.sh:
 1. Use GPIO instead of dbus for host state
 2. Wait 3 seconds before checking power status for power on
 3. Wait 6 seconds before checking power status for power off
 4. Have force_off act GPIO while power_off sets Chassis state
 5. Graceful shutdown acts GPIO
 6. Check host status before issuing system reset
 7. Set Watchdog Expire Action to None before power off and reset

Signed-off-by: Charles Boyer <Charles.Boyer@fii-usa.com>
Change-Id: Ie2720ee60d489c4160165c6827a78a400ae4d30b

Why do we need the service always by entity-manager and dbus-sensors. I thought the entity-manager works on updates to the FRU interface. so once the FRU's are scanned there shouldn't be any new update to that interface and stopping the FRU service should not affect that.

From my understanding, entity-manager will continue to reference FruDevice for new devices or change in devices. If FruDevice stops, then the EM probes fail, and I observe the inventory entries depopulate for MB and BMC boards. Another side effect of these losses is that Redfish will not have Chassis members, which it obtained from this inventory.

Another related question I have is why did it think that FruDevice was no longer needed if it is used by EM? I think FruDevice should not have stopped.
Can you check with Entity Manager maintainers? I think if this is a problem. This has to be fixed directly in EM repo
Checked with some of the Entity Manager maintainers, and then agreed to submit the following change: https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/entity-manager/+/46752.
thanks for following up.
The FruDevice service change has been removed, considering that the change has been made in entity-manager.
old override syntax. Need to be changed to latest.
Done
Can this be made into a separate commit?
Done
Why is this delay needed?

The chassis-state-manager checks for initial chassis state when it starts. Without this delay, the system is still powering up when chassis-state-manager starts, so PS_PWROK signal is low causing initial chassis state to be Off. After the initial chassis state check, the chassis state will not change except for requested power transitions from power control actions.
ok thanks.
